0.name: 1Prisoner note
0.text:
I found some pen and paper stached below my cold, hard mattress.
Meaning I can FINALLY write down some of my problems with this BROKEN justice system.

For one, I AM INNOCENT!
I would never EVER do that to my wife and children.
And the fact that they never even had a look at the evidence I provided.
HORRID!

If I ever get the opportunity to het out of this hell hole..
I will sue the everliving hell out of those people.
Justice my ass.

Meanwhile I'm sure that monster is still out there.
AGHH
What he did to my children, my Jane..

If I ever find him I'll be happy to watch him ROT behind these same bars that I find myself behind.
HE belongs in a cell on Alcatras NOT ME!

Though unfortunately they gave me life in prison.
I don't think I'll ever be able to get true justice.

1.name: 2Prisoner note
1.text:
I remember that moment... clear as day.
I was at work when I received a message from my wife Jane.'There's people in the house'.
I told her to grab the gun from my desk and hide with the kids in the bedroom closet.
'I am on my way' I said.

While driving home I got a call from my nextdoor neighbor.
She said she heard screams and gunshots from our apartment.
And that her husband called the police.
I should have never gone home after I heard that...

When I finally got home, I burst through the door and...
I found her..
On the floor in the kitchen..
She had been shot multiple times and her body was partially flayed.

And before I could even see what he did to my children, the cops ran in and I was arrested on the spot.

But as we drove away. I saw him I SAW HIM.
His crooked smile and those fiery eyes staring at me through the bushes, still covered in Jane's blood.

I will never forget that face.

2.name: 3Prisoner note
2.text:
I've been here for six weeks now.
They told me there will be a retrial for my case!
THANK GOD!
Maybe this time they will actually have a close look at all the evidence I've provided.
This also means I can FINALLY leave this place.
Even if temporarily.

We're also slowly being moved to another prison I've heard.
I really hope it's a little nicer because I am SICK of waking up to a swarm of rats running around our cells.

The activities here are horrible too.
We can't even work out since most of the equipment is either broken or extremely dirty.

They cleared out a couple cell blocks already.
I think we might be next.

This does mean I'll have to leave my notes here.
I don't think I can sneak those with me.

i will find justice for you Jane.
I loved you.

3.name: Guard note
3.text:
This poor guy didn't deserve this.
I wonder if there are any other innocent prisoners here.

If I knew this I would've made sure he wasn't put with the others.
But.
We're all just following orders here.

It's vile what we do here.
Poor guy thought he'd be moved.
We don't keep prisoners here.
We kill them and turn their bodies into soil.
Soil which is used to grow crops at an extraordinary rate.
These crops are then sold back to the public.

People would go crazy if they knew about this.
I would too.
But that's just our job.

I hate it but.. it's how money gets made.
